q:
Bob while working on a project on the operating system, came across a file access strategy. From the accompanying options which clarify the consecutive file access strategy:

  1. Arbitrary access as per the given byte number 
  2. Read bytes each in turn, in order
  3. Read/write consecutively by record
  4. Read/write randomly by record

While working on a project of Operating system, Bob had to backup a certain file in the file system. Now, he wants to access that file but is not sure about the extension used. Which of the below given filename extension suggests that the file is a backup copy of another file?

Bob while working on a project on an operating system, which among the following is included in mount operation?

  1. Name of the network
  2. Name of the remote directory to be mounted
  3. Name of the server machine mounting it
  4. All of these

While working on a project on an Operating system, you came across a consistency checker. What does a consistency checker do other than attempting to fix any irregularities it finds:

  1. Compares the data in the secondary storage with the data in the cache
  2. Compares the data in the index structure with the data blocks on disk
  3. Compares the system created output and client required output
  4. All of the above

While working on a project of Operating system Bob came across the term mounting of the file system. From the options given below choose the best-suited explanation?

  1. Crafting of a file system
  2. Deleting of a file system
  3. Attaching portion of the file system into the directory structure
  4. Removing portion of the file system into the directory structure

An application loads 100 libraries at startup and stacking every library precisely one disk access is required. 10ms is the seek time of the disk to an arbitrary location and 6000rpm is the rotational speed of the disk. Disregard the time to move data from the disk block once the head has been situated at the beginning of the block. What will be the time taken by the application to stack all the libraries, if every one of the 100 libraries is stacked from a random location on the disk?

You are working on a project in the Operating system. In which method the file allocation table contains a separate one-level index for each file if the index has one entry for each portion allocated to the file?
Which among the following are mostly used in applications where data are rarely processed exhaustively?
What is the preallocation strategy using variable size portions where the file allocation table needs just a single entry for each file, showing the starting block and the length of the file?

Suppose you are working on Linux OS as user - “root”. You have created a file with the name “Sample”. You should add permissions to the file, for example, who can read, write and execute that file. Also, it should be a hidden file for some users and only the allowed users should be able to view the file. Now, there is a user “John” whom you need to give the same permissions to access the file, as a root user possesses.

1. How can you give access so that the root user and “John” can only access it?
2. How can you view the permissions of the file?

Options

  1. setfacl -m u:John:rw Sample
getfacl Sample
  2. setfacl -m u:John:rwx Sample
getfacl Sample

     

  3. setfacl -m u:John:rwx- Sample.txt
getfacl Sample.txt

     

  4. setfacl -m u:John:rwx- Sample
getfacl Sample

You have created a file named Data (Linux) by collecting different types of information about cables. Now, to make it well sorted you have to arrange the content in two columns.

File named 'Data': busy@virtualBox: ~$ cat Data
100" - A wire
50'2" - Special Purpose
9" - Rare use stuff
10mm - Thickness
5mm - Standard Thickness
Collectives
Extendable - 100"
Standard Weld joint
For socket set - 5
Extendable socket - 10-20
Total Data For processing start
busy@virtualBox: ~$

What is the command & the result?

Options

  1. busy@virtualBox: ~$ pr -2 Data 2021-06-10 19:11 Data Page 1 100" - A wire Extendable - 100 
50'2" - Special Purpose Standard Weld joint 
9" - Rare use stuff For socket set - 5 
10mm - Thickness Extendable socket - 10-20 
5mm - Standard Thickness Total Data For processing start 
Collectives
  2. busy@virtualBox: ~$ pr -2 Data 2021-06-10 19:11 Data Page 1 100" - A wire 
50'2" - Special Purpose 
9" - Rare use stuff 
10mm - Thickness 
5mm - Standard Thickness .
Collectives Extendable - 100"
Standard Weld joint
For socket set - 5
Extendable socket - 10-20
Total Data For processing start

     

  3. busy@virtualBox: ~$ lp -2 Data 2021-06-10 19:11 Data Page 1 100" - A wire Extendable - 100 
50'2" - Special Purpose Standard Weld joint 
9" - Rare use stuff For socket set - 5 
10mm - Thickness Extendable socket - 10-20 
5mm - Standard Thickness Total Data For processing start 
Collectives

     

  4. busy@virtualBox: ~$ lp -2 Data 2021-06-10 19:11 Data Page 1 100" - A wire 
50'2" - Special Purpose 
9" - Rare use stuff 
10mm - Thickness 
5mm - Standard Thickness .
Collectives Extendable - 100"
Standard Weld joint
For socket set - 5
Extendable socket - 10-20
Total Data For processing start

You are working in a Linux environment. There are two directories available in the root. They are labeled as direc1, direc2. In the direc1 directory, there are three files namely file1.txt, file2.txt, file3.txt whereas, the direc2 directory has a file named file1.txt. Now, you have to move the files from direc1 to direc2 but only those filenames which are absent in direc2. Hence, you should avoid overriding.
Which of the following commands is correct according to the given information?

  1. mv direc1/* to direc2/

     

  2. mv -u direc2/* to direc1/

     

  3. mv -u direc1 to direc2

     

  4. mv -u direc1/* to direc2/

In Linux OS, you have a directory named “mydata” which contains a few files with different types of extensions. Also, there is a file named “sample.txt”. Now, we need to get the type of each file that is present in the directory whose file name starts with any alphabet in the specified range, type of given file, and the extensions of all files.
What are the best suitable commands to get the above-mentioned outputs considering the range as b to m?

Options

  1. file /mydata/[b-m]*
file sample.txt
file /mydata/*
  2. file /mydata/[b-m]*
file /mydata/sample.txt
file /mydata/*

     

  3. file [b-m]*
file sample.txt
file *

     

  4. file [ b-m]*
file /mydata/sample.txt
file *

In a sesson of learning about Linux files, you created files and now you want to move the file "Project" to location /home/1_Project/DocFile. Executing the command:
your@virtualbox: ~$ mv Project /home/1_Project/DocFile
What is the result of this?

Options

  1. mv : cannot move '1_Project' to '/home/Project/DocFile' : File not Found
  2. your@virtualbox: ~$ mv saved

     

  3. mv : cannot move 'Project' to '/home/1_Project/DocFile' : Permission Denied

     

  4. your@virtualbox: ~$ Project /home/1_Project/DocFile

You have created a regular file with the command given:

$ touch freshlearn.com
$ ls -ld freshlearn.com
-rw-rw-r-- 1 lubos lubos 0 June 10 12:52 freshlearn.com

Now you want to remove the mentioned command. How can you perform this task?

Options

  1. $ brw freshlearn.com

     

  2. $ rm freshlearn.com

     

  3. $ unlink freshearn.com

     

  4. $ rmdir freshlearn.com

For sending mails through a terminal, you have installed packages 'mailutils' and now you have to use the appropriate syntax & command for sending an email.
Which of the following is the correct option for the program to be performed?

Options

  1. office@virtualbox: ~$ mail -s "Assesment Work" bhatt@gmail.com Hello, PFA for the designed files, and new task updation is awaited. Thank You ! Regards, XYZ
  2. office@virtualbox: ~$ message -c "Assesment Work" bhatt@gmail.com Hello, PFA for the designed files, and new task updation is awaited. Thank You ! Regards, XYZ

     

  3. office@virtualbox: ~$ message -s "Assesment Work" bhatt@gmail.com Hello, PFA for the designed files, and new task updation is awaited. Thank You ! Regards, XYZ

     

  4. Syntax Error !

In an operating system, which of the following information is stored in the Process Control Block (PCB):

  1. Process ID
  2. CPU registers
  3. State of a process
  4. CPU scheduling information

In an operating system, which of the following are different types of FAT (File Allocation Table) file system?

  1. FAT8
  2. FAT16
  3. FAT32
  4. FAT64

In an operating system, which of the following statements about the symbolic link are true:

  1. A symbolic link can be deleted without deleting the actual file it links.
  2. There can be only one symbolic link attached to a single file.
  3. Each time a link is created, the reference count in its inode is incremented by one.
  4. There can be any number of symbolic links attached to a single file.

In an operating system, which of the following statements about the two-level directory structure are true:

  1. Each user gets their own directory space.
  2. File names have to be unique, even for different users.
  3. A master file directory is used to keep track of each users directory.
  4. A user is not allowed to share files with other users.
In Hadoop, which of the commands is used to check the health status of FileSystem?

In an operating system, which of the following data structures is used for directory information:

  1. Linked list
  2. Sorted list
  3. Hash table
  4. Linked binary tree
In an operating system, which of these problems might arise if a linked list is used for the directory information?

a.option: Slow in accessing a particular file
Extra overhead of sorting the list always
